intro: Rotang scipionum, commonly known as the wild rubber tree, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves and produces a milky sap that is rich in latex. The plant belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is often found in moist, lowland forests. Its latex has been historically used in the production of natural rubber. The plant's botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and economic contexts.
